DOC.brief_summary: Cryotherapy resource apply thermal rehabilitation order reduce skin temperature muscle well nerve conduction velocity , promote vasoconstriction artery vein result decrease blood flow . Thus , study aim evaluate neuromuscular biomechanical ass hemodynamic autonomic cardiovascular , investigate occurrence change conduction velocity due superficial blood cryotherapy immersion forearm . The study conduct 40 volunteer , female , 18 30 year , university , healthy . They divide two group 20 volunteer , group immersion cryotherapy ( GI ) control group ( CG ) . For immersion cryotherapy group ( GI ) , individual right arm elbow immerse container water 6°C ± 2°C 15 minute . In control group ( CG ) , volunteer remain rest right arm position within vessel contain water temperature indifferent period 15 minute . The temperature analysis perform use infrared thermographer , muscular strength synergism evaluate load cell connect electromyograph examine muscle activation wrist flexor extensor , serratus anterior , upper middle trapezius . The record beat beat blood pressure heart rate cardiovascular autonomic hemodynamic evaluation carry means equipment Finometer electrocardiogram , respectively , application cryotherapy . In turn , data blood flow velocity collect mean Doppler Ultrasound . The result process analyzed use descriptive statistic , submit linear regression model mixed effect ( fix random effect ) , p≤0.05 .
DOC.brief_title: Analysis Neuromuscular , Circulatory Biomechanical Responses After Cryotherapy Immersion Forearm
DOC.criteria: healthy individual , age range : 18 30 year old present : previous circulatory , nervous metabolic disease , metal implant area study ; fracture upper limb study ; history pain injury joint study menstrual period week making use antipyretic drug
